article.headline: UT-Chattanooga 90, Wofford 79
article.story: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn. (AP) -- Ashley Champion scored 28 points as Chattanooga beat Wofford 90-79 on Saturday night. The Terriers (8-19, 4-12 Southern Conference) only led once 39-38 with 1:59 left in the first half after a 3-pointer by Adrien Borders, who finished with 22 points. Chattanooga (17-10, 10-6) took control in the opening minutes of the second half, and the Mocs extended their lead to 75-58 with 9:28 left. Wofford relied heavily on 3-point shooting, hitting 11 in the first half. But the Terriers struggled in the second half, and only converted two of their attempts to finish 13-of-34. Mindaugas Katelynas scored 18 points, Ray Trowell had 14 and Bryan Richardson added 11 for the Mocs. Wofford's Sam Daniels scored 20 points and Howard Wilkerson had 14 points.
